steps.title: Overview of the Interface
steps.content: Welcome to the Mars Rover Simulator! Let's start by exploring the main components of our interface.

steps.title: The Control Panel
steps.content: The control panel is where you'll find all the buttons and indicators for operating your rover.

steps.title: The View Screen
steps.content: The view screen shows you what your rover sees on the Martian surface.

steps.title: Using the Compass
steps.content: Your rover is equipped with a compass to help you navigate the Martian terrain.

steps.title: Understanding Coordinates
steps.content: Learn how to read and use the coordinate system to pinpoint your rover's location.

steps.title: Movement Controls
steps.content: Learn how to move your rover forward, backward, and turn left or right.

steps.title: Camera Controls
steps.content: Discover how to pan and tilt the rover's camera for better visibility.

steps.title: Basic Maneuvers
steps.content: Practice simple movements like driving in a straight line and making turns.

steps.title: Obstacle Avoidance
steps.content: Learn how to navigate around rocks and other obstacles on the Martian surface.

steps.title: Moving Forward and Backward
steps.content: Practice precise control of your rover's forward and backward movements.

steps.title: Turning and Rotating
steps.content: Learn how to make accurate turns and rotate the rover in place.

steps.title: Navigating Curved Paths
steps.content: Master the art of guiding your rover along curved and complex paths.

steps.title: Precision Parking
steps.content: Learn how to park your rover in tight spaces with pinpoint accuracy.

steps.title: Identifying Terrain Features
steps.content: Learn to recognize different Martian terrain types and geological features.

steps.title: Navigating Slopes
steps.content: Master the technique of safely traversing up and down Martian slopes.

steps.title: Using the Robotic Arm
steps.content: Learn how to operate the rover's robotic arm for sample collection.

steps.title: Analyzing Samples
steps.content: Understand how to use the rover's onboard instruments to analyze collected samples.

steps.title: Using Spectroscopy
steps.content: Learn how to use the rover's spectrometer to analyze the composition of Martian rocks and soil.

steps.title: Weather Station Operations
steps.content: Operate the rover's weather station to collect atmospheric data on Mars.

steps.title: Path Planning
steps.content: Learn how to program the rover to plan its own path across Martian terrain.

steps.title: Autonomous Obstacle Detection
steps.content: Set up the rover's systems to autonomously detect and avoid obstacles.

steps.title: Mission Briefing
steps.content: Receive your final mission parameters and objectives for the Mars exploration challenge.

steps.title: Execute the Mission
steps.content: Put all your learned skills to the test in a complex, multi-objective Mars exploration mission.

steps.title: Mission Debrief
steps.content: Analyze your performance and receive feedback on your Mars exploration mission.

steps.title: Written Examination
steps.content: Complete a comprehensive written test covering all aspects of Mars rover operations and Martian science.

steps.title: Practical Examination
steps.content: Demonstrate your rover operation skills in a series of challenging practical tests.

steps.title: Final Evaluation and Certification
steps.content: Receive your final evaluation and, if successful, your Mars Rover Operator Certification.
